Along with its social media campaigns, the IRA was in direct contact with "unwitting" members, volunteers and supporters of the Trump campaign, according to Mueller's indictment.
The indictment does not reveal which members of the campaign were in contact with the Russians, but notes that at least three "campaign officials" had communicated with them.
While the indictment stresses that it does not prove that Trump officials colluded with the Kremlin, it does note that there's no evidence denying it either.
